item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Michael Vick embraces new opportunity with Philadelphia Eagles
item.description: Describing the opportunity as a "surreal feeling," Michael Vick was introduced Friday as a member of the Eagles, a fresh start for the disgraced quarterback who recently completed a near two-year prison sentence for bankrolling a dogfighting ring.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Denver Broncos wide receiver Brandon Marshall found not guilty in battery case
item.description: A jury in Atlanta has found Denver Broncos wide receiver Brandon Marshall not guilty of misdemeanor battery.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Carolina Panthers receiver Steve Smith makes surprise return to practice
item.description: Carolina Panthers receiver Steve Smith has made a surprise return to practice four days after suffering a right shoulder injury.

item.dc:creator: Paul Kuharsky
item.title: Jacksonville Jaguars first-round pick Eugene Monroe agrees to five-year deal
item.description: The Jaguars and first-round pick Eugene Monroe have come to terms on a five-year deal, according to The Florida Times-Union.

item.dc:creator: Kevin Seifert
item.title: Sage Rosenfels will start at quarterback for Minnesota Vikings in preseason opener
item.description: Sage Rosenfels will start at quarterback in the Vikings' preseason opener at Indianapolis, coach Brad Childress said Friday morning.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Boston Red Sox acquire shortstop Alex Gonzalez from Cincinnati Reds
item.description: The Red Sox acquired shortstop Alex Gonzalez from the Reds on Friday for a minor leaguer.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Michael Phelps uninjured after two-car accident; police say other driver at fault
item.description: Baltimore police say the other driver was at fault in a crash involving Olympic champion Michael Phelps.

item.dc:creator: Chad Millman
item.title: Leagues granted hearing to stop Delaware sports betting
item.description: An appeals court ruling gives leagues last chance to halt sports betting before Sept. 1

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Rogers Cup: Roger Federer's 22-match win streak ends in Rogers Cup quarterfinals
item.description: Andy Murray has ended Nikolay Davydenko's 12-match winning streak with a 6-2, 6-4 victory in the quarterfinals of the Rogers Cup.

item.dc:creator: Dana O'Neil
item.title: Reggie Redding of Villanova Wildcats to be ineligible during fall semester
item.description: Villanova senior Reggie Redding will be ineligible for games during the fall semester, the university said.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Former Louisiana Tech player Lavelle Felton dies after getting shot in head
item.description: Milwaukee police are investigating the shooting of a European league basketball player who was shot after leaving a gas station.

item.dc:creator: External
item.title: In progress: Mickelson struggling at PGA

item.dc:creator: Brian Bennett
item.title: Source: Big East nears deal for No. 2, No. 3 slots with Champs Sports Bowl, Sun Bowl
item.description: The Big East is close to a deal that would send its No. 2 team to the Champs Sports Bowl in Orlando and its No. 3 to the Sun Bowl, a source close to the negotiations said.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Dirk Nowitzki of Dallas Mavericks won't play for Germany at European Championship
item.description: Germany will be without Dallas Mavericks star Dirk Nowitzki at next month's European Championship in Poland.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Donte' Stallworth of Cleveland Browns suspended without pay for 2009 season
item.description: Donte' Stallworth has been suspended without pay for the 2009 season, the NFL said Thursday.
